name: train_fmu_gym
vendor: German Aerospace Center (DLR), Institute of Vehicle Concepts, Department of Vehicle System Dynamics and Control
description: A Python-based framework leveraging the Functional Mock-up Interface (FMI) to train, validate, and assess Deep Reinforcement Learning agents

name: ONNX2FMU
description: Wrap Open Neural Network eXchange (ONNX)-compatible models into Functional Mockup Units

name: iSILOG.Connect.PLCConnect
vendor: EDAG Production Solutions GmbH & Co. KG
description: Connect and simulate FMU, SSPs, and AASX files together with automation and visualisation systems in a single framework. Visualization systems include, but are not limited to: Siemens NX Mechatronics Concept Designer, Visual Components, and NVIDIA Omniverse.

name: iSILOG.Connect.SSPFactory
vendor: EDAG Production Solutions GmbH & Co. KG
description: Generation tool to load and save SSPs in the 2.0 standard

name: iSILOG.Connect.FMUPlayer
vendor: EDAG Production Solutions GmbH & Co. KG
description: Simulate and validate FMUs, SSPs, and AASX files

name: Desmo
vendor: PACE Aerospace Engineering and IT GmbH
description: Desmo is a comprehensive knowledge-based engineering design software suite for the modelling, sizing, analysis and optimization of new and derivative aircraft in the conceptual and preliminary design phase. Desmo extends the capabilities beyond the aircraft design by enabling the definition and analysis of aircraft system architectures and energy management. In addition to defining and modeling aircraft systems, you can also analyze their performance and ultimately their impact on the overall aircraft performance (e.g. thermal, fuel consumption, weights).

name: aiSim
description: aiSim is a high-fidelity, ISO26262-certified sensor and environment simulation software for automated driving and ADAS development

name: DistrictLab® SimulationStudio
description: The SimulationStudio is a graphical modelling environment for district heating and cooling simulation and Model-Based Design.

name: rust-fmi
description: A Rust interface to FMUs (Functional Mock-up Units) that follow the FMI Standard.

name: RTMaps
description: RTMaps is a component-based development and execution software tool. FMUs can be easily integrated as components in our framework for co-simulation.

name: preCICE-FMI Runner
description: preCICE is a coupling library for partitioned multi-physics simulations. FMUs can be coupled to PDE-based simulation programs like OpenFOAM and FEniCS with the preCICE-FMI runner software (experimental).

name: 20-sim
description: Modeling and simulation program for mechatronic systems and control

name: @Source
description: Simulink via @Source

name: NeurEco
description: Automatic parsimonious neural network factory

name: Adams
description: High end multibody dynamics simulation software from Hexagon

name: ADEPT Framework
description: Industrial data and control software platform built around the concept of a data framework that links real-time Linux servers as a distributed resource and provides desktop client control of the time-deterministic computing and data handling capability

name: Dynamics
description: AGX Dynamics is a professional multi-purpose physics engine for simulators, engineering, large scale granular simulators and more

name: Altair Twin Activate
description: Software environment for modeling, simulation and analysis of multi-disciplinary systems

name: Altair MotionSolve
description: MotionSolve is a solver that performs 3D multi-body system simulations to predict the dynamic response and optimize the performance of products that move.

name: Altair MotionView
description: MotionView is a graphical environment for building multibody system models and for visualizing motion simulation results using animations and plots.

name: CFX
description: Ansys CFX is a general purpose CFD package with advanced turbomachinery capabilities

name: Fluent
description: Ansys Fluent is an industry-leading fluid simulation software known for its advanced physics modeling capabilities and industry leading accuracy

name: DesignXplorer
description: DesignXplorer is able to export a computed response surface as an FMU

name: Motor-CAD
description: Ansys Motor-CAD is a dedicated electric machine design tool for fast multiphysics simulation across the full torque-speed operating range

name: SCADE Display
description: Model-based development environment for safe and reliable embedded human-machine interfaces (HMI) software

name: SCADE Suite
description: Model-based development environment for safe and reliable embedded control software, from design to safety certified code generation

name: Scade One
description: Model-based solution for the development of embedded control, mission and autonomy software, enabling a seamless MBSE process from the start. Successor of the SCADE products family.

name: Twin Builder
description: Ansys Twin Builder enables you to quickly create a digital twin–a connected replica of an in-service asset.

name: AutoFOCUS3
description: AutoFOCUS3 is a model-based tool and research platform for the design, development and validation of safety-critical embedded systems developed at fortiss

name: AUTOSAR Builder
description: AUTOSAR Builder is a powerful, flexible, and open AUTOSAR authoring and test solution enabling modeling, test, and validation of in-vehicle embedded systems. It fully supports the AUTOSAR standard, both Classic and Adaptive, in one environment.

name: CRUISE
description: Vehicle system analysis tool for the optimization of fuel efficiency, emission, performance and driveability, from office to HiL to testbed.

name: CRUISE M
description: AVL CRUISE™ M is a realtime, multi-disciplinary, vehicle system simulation software used in office environments for the design of powertrains and thermal management systems, in HiL environments for control function development and calibration, and in testbed environments to provide simulation models for component testing.

name: EXCITE M
description: AVL EXCITE™ M is a multi-body dynamic simulation software for powertrains that provides the answers before problems occur. Any powertrain system, whether internal combustion engine-based, hybrid, or pure electric, can be simulated. By creating a high-fidelity virtual twin, engineers can predict potential issues early in the design process – from component or bearing failure to noise and vibration concerns. AVL EXCITE™ M helps optimize designs and validate performance in a virtual environment. The result is a streamlined development process that ensures products meet durability, noise, and vibration targets before production begins.

name: Model.CONNECT
description: AVL’s open model integration and co-simulation platform, connecting virtual and real components into one functional prototype

name: Maestra
description: AVL’s Tool to develop compliant software with quality and safety standards such as Automotive Spice (ASPICE) and ISO 26262

name: exothermia suite
description: Simulation of exhaust aftertreatment systems from Exothermia

name: Automation Studio
description: B&Rs Automation Studio is a software engineering platform for industrial automation targetting PLCs, industrial PCs, HMI and embedded controllers from B&R

name: BEAST
description: BEAST is an advanced dynamic simulation tool for rolling bearings and other mechanical systems with contacts available through SKF Engineering Consultancy Services. BEAST analyzes what will happen under real conditions and predicts the behaviour of complex equipment that incorporates rolling bearings.

name: TwinCAT
description: The TwinCAT software system turns almost any PC-based system into a real-time control with multiple PLC, NC, CNC and/or robotics runtime systems.

name: Controls Virtual Test Bed
description: BCVTB is a software environment, based on Ptolemy II, for co-simulation of, and data exchange with, building energy and control systems

name: Cameo Systems Modeler
description: Cameo Systems Modeler™ is an industry leading cross-platform collaborative Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) environment, which provides smart, robust, and intuitive tools to define, track, and visualize all aspects of systems in the most standard-compliant SysML models and diagrams.

name: CANoe
description: CANoe is the comprehensive software tool for development, test and analysis of entire ECU networks and individual ECUs

name: CarMaker
description: CarMaker is an open test- and integration-platform for MiL, SiL and HiL that allows to implement virtual test scenarios for the application areas ADAS, AD, Powertrain and Vehicle Dynamics provided by IPG Automotive.

name: CarSim
description: CarSim, TruckSim, and BikeSim are vehicle dynamics software solutions from Mechanical Simulation that support XiL development workflows and power real-time driving simulators around the globe

name: 3DEXPERIENCE (CATIA)
description: 3DEXPERIENCE is a multi-platform software suite for computer-aided design, computer-aided manufacturing, computer-aided engineering, 3D modeling and product lifecycle management.

name: Collimator
description: Cloud-based platform to model, simulate, and optimize complex dynamical systems with a combination of physics and machine learning. Built on an open core powered by Python and JAX.

name: pycollimator
description: Python package powering Collimator's Python- and cloud-native simulation platform. It contains both a local high-performance simulation engine built with JAX, and a client API to run simulations in the cloud.

name: ControlBuild
description: ControlBuild is an innovative environment for designing and validating distributed control and monitoring systems. Based on a model-driven approach and supported by a structured set of libraries, ControlBuild is used to efficiently model, simulate, test, validate, and deploy IEC 61131-3 control applications.

name: CosiMate
description: Co-simulation Environment from ChiasTek

name: CoTherm
description: Co-simulation software for coupling thermal, CFD, FEA, and 1D tools

name: CPPFMU
description: Interfaces and helper functions for developing FMI-compliant co-simulation subsystems in C++

name: CENIT
description: Industrial product for nonlinear Model Predictive Control (NMPC) from Cybernetica

name: ModelFit
description: Software for model verification, state and parameter estimation, using logged process data. By Cybernetica

name: DACCOSIM
description: Master Algorithm generator & deployer from RISEGrid for a multi-OS, multi-threaded and distributed cosimulation implementing all the FMI 2.0 features

name: DAE Tools
description: Equation-based object-oriented modelling, simulation and optimisation software

name: Motion
description: Ansys Motion enables fast and accurate analysis of rigid and flexible bodies, and gives accurate evaluation of physical events through the analysis of the mechanical system as a whole

name: PowerFactory
description: PowerFactory is a power system analysis software application used for analysing generation, transmission, distribution and industrial systems

name: ConfigurationDesk
description: ConfigurationDesk is an intuitive, graphical configuration and implementation tool, ideal for handling applications from small Rapid Control Prototyping (RCP) developments to large Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) tests based on dSPACE real-time hardware, such as SCALEXIO, MicroLabBox II or MicroAutoBox III, including the implementation of behavior models and I/O function code.

name: MicroAutoBox III
description: MicroAutoBox III is a real-time simulation system for performing fast, in-vehicle function prototyping. Simulations for MicroAutoBox III are implemented with ConfigurationDesk.

name: MicroLabBox II
description: MicroLabBox II is a compact and powerful development and test system for rapid control prototyping and hardware-in-the-loop applications. Simulations for MicroLabBox II are implemented with ConfigurationDesk.

name: SCALEXIO
description: SCALEXIO is a modular and scalable real-time platform for hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) and rapid control prototyping (RCP) applications. SCALEXIO offers high-performance processor technology for demanding real-time requirements as well as comprehensive, precise, and fast I/O capabilities. Simulations for SCALEXIO are implemented with ConfigurationDesk.

name: SystemDesk
description: SystemDesk is an environment for creating virtual ECUs for SIL simulation. Virtual ECUs can be on application level or they can contain up to the complete hardware-independent ECU software.

name: TargetLink
description: TargetLink is a production code generator from dSPACE that generates highly efficient C-code directly from Simulink/Stateflow models.

name: VEOS
description: VEOS is a PC-based virtual integration and simulation platform from dSPACE.

name: Dymola
description: Dymola, Dynamic Modeling Laboratory, is a complete tool for modeling and simulation of integrated and complex systems for use within automotive, aerospace, robotics, process and other applications.

name: DYNA4
description: DYNA4 by Vector is an open simulation environment for virtual test driving for function development in closed-loop system tests

name: EAS-CoSiMa
description: EAS-CoSiMa by Fraunhofer IIS EAS is a vendor neutral interface for Co-Simulation of FMUs. It provides a range of Masteralgorithms for cycle handling, time step control algorithms and a graphical user interface.

name: Easy FMI Add-on for Matlab/Simulink
description: FMI Module for Simulink to enable cosimulation as master or slave

name: Easy5
description: High performance simulation environment for multi-domain system dynamics from Hexagon

name: EcosimPro
description: EcosimPro, System Modelling and Simulation Software

name: ecu.test
description: ecu.test is an intuitive test tool for creating test cases for automotive software and other domains in any development phase and for their automatic execution, supporting a variety of test execution and test process tools.

name: EMTP
description: EMTP-RV is a power system simulation tool. Version 3.4 or higher is required to use the FMI capabilities.

name: EnergyPlus FMU export
description: Utility to export the Energyplus whole building energy simulation program as an FMU

name: EnergyPlus
description: Whole building energy simulation program

name: ASCET-DEVELOPER
description: FMU Generator for ASCET from ETAS

name: ASCMO
description: Creation and export of statistical (meta) models using Design of Experiments (DoE) from ETAS

name: COSYM
description: Integration and simulation platform for Hardware-in-the-Loop (HiL) and Software-in-the-Loop (SiL)

name: ETAS Simulation Engine
description: ETAS Simulation Engine integrates embedded software and plant models into a system simulation. The tool supports interactive experimentation and continuous testing. It is optimized for use in pipelines and cloud environments.

name: INCA-FLOW (MiL Connector Toolbox)
description: Guided and automated calibration of FMUs with connection to ETAS INCA

name: MDA V8
description: Measure Data Analysis tool which allows to load FMU files and assign inputs to the model. The model's outputs can be used in MDA like ordinary signals, e.g. for visualization, input for further calculations, export of values into a new measurement file.

name: VECU-BUILDER
description: ETAS VECU-BUILDER is a tool to generate stand-alone runnable virtual ECUs for verification and validation of automotive microcontroller software in Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) setups. Input sources may be AUTOSAR-compliant source codes, non-AUTOSAR-compliant source code and even PC binaries.

name: fe.screen-sim
description: Simulation, planning and virtual commissioning for complex conveyance engineering systems as well as mechanical engineering, robotics and logistics

name: Flownex
description: Flownex is a tool for steady state and dynamic simulation of fluid flow and heat transfer systems

name: DSHplus
description: Fluid power simulation software from FLUIDON

name: Virtual Engineering Lab
description: Software for automated simulation and virtual engineering using in-the-loop methods

name: FMI add-on for NI VeriStand
description: NI VeriStand supports FMI through the use of the FMI add-on for NI VeriStand from Dofware

name: FMI Bench
description: FMI Bench is a workbench for the inspection, customization and integration of FMUs, based on FMI and SSP standards. It includes encryption, distribution, parallelization and stand-alone simulation generation.

name: FMI Blockset for Simulink
description: The FMI Blockset for Simulink enables the import of FMUs for use in Simulink - developed by Claytex

name: FMI Library
description: Open source (BSD) C library for integration of FMI technology in custom applications by Modelon

name: FMI Toolbox for MATLAB/Simulink
description: The FMI Toolbox for MATLAB/Simulink from Modelon enables FMU import and export for MATLAB/Simulink for both model exchange and co-simulation

name: FMI.jl
description: Load or create, parameterize, differentiate and simulate FMUs seamlessly inside the Julia programming language

name: FMIExchange.jl
description: Compatibility layer between the FMI standard and the DifferentialEquations.jl Julia package. Compose simulations with multiple FMUs and native models.

name: FMI4cpp
description: FMI 2.0 implementation written in modern C++

name: FMI4j
description: FMI4j is a software package for dealing with Functional Mockup Units (FMUs) on the JVM platform

name: FMPy
description: FMPy is a free Python library to inspect, compile and simulate FMUs with a rich graphical user interface, flexible API, and a command line interface.

name: FMU-proxy
description: Tool that allows Functional Mock-up Units (FMUs) to be accessed through language independent RPC calls on any platform using gRPC, Apache Thrift and/or JSON-RPC

name: FMU4cpp
description: Build FMUs using modern C++

name: GCAir
description: Cosimulation and Hardware-In-the-Loop platform

name: GCKontrol
description: tool for modeling, embedded code generation and simulation

name: Energy Systems (GES)
description: GES is an object oriented simulation tool, for dynamic and static (algebraic) systems, Based on a hybrid bondgraph model. The tool is mainly used for ship power designs. Provided by TNO

name: gemseo-fmu
description: Load, simulate, co-simulate and manipulate FMUs based on GEMSEO, an open source Python library to automate multidisciplinary processes, starting with multidisciplinary design optimization (MDO) ones.

name: GT-SUITE
description: Multi-Physics Simulation Platform for Powertrain and Vehicle Systems

name: Hopsan
description: A system simulation tool based on distributed solvers, focused mostly on fluid and mechatronic systems.

name: Rational Rhapsody
description: IBM® Rational® Rhapsody® family provides a collaborative design, development and test environment for systems engineers and software engineers.

name: IGNITE
description: Physics-based system simulation software for complete vehicle system modeling and simulation from Ricardo Software

name: Co-simulation Orchestration Engine (COE)
description: An open-source and free standalone FMI co-simulation master implemented in Java with a JSON API. It is developed as part of the INTO-CPS project.

name: ISG-virtuos
description: Technology-specific simulation solutions are integrated into the digital twin which enables a comprehensive virtual commissioning of industrial control systems. Result: Illustration of interactions between process machine control system and user in a single integrated virtualization.

name: JavaFMI
description: JavaFMI is a Java wrapper for the Functional Mock-up Interface (1.0 or 2.0) both for Windows/Linux 32 or 64 bit OS

name: KULI
description: KULI is a comprehensive tool for vehicle thermal management simulation

name: Virtual.Lab Motion
description: Virtual.Lab Motion is a high end multi body software

name: LS-DYNA
description: Ansys LS-DYNA is an industry-leading explicit simulation software used for applications like drop tests, impact and penetration, smashes and crashes, occupant safety, and more.

name: MapleSim
description: Modelica-based modeling and simulation tool from Maplesoft

name: MASTERSIM
description: MASTERSIM is an OpenSource FMI Co-Simulation master programm. It allows graphical routing and fast matching of connections, has a simple text-based project file (suitable for scripting), and several Co-Simulation master algorithms implemented. It is very efficiently and thoroughly validated, particularly in coupling scenarios.

name: MATLAB® Simulink®
description: Simulink® is a block diagram environment for multidomain simulation and Model-Based Design. It supports system-level design, simulation, automatic code generation, and continuous test and verification of embedded systems.

name: Simulink® Real-Time
description: Simulink® Real-Time enables rapid control prototyping and hardware-in-the-loop testing with MATLAB® and Simulink®

name: MESSINA
description: MESSINA is a test platform for model-based ECU function development.

name: CAPE
description: CAPE (NovaCarts Application Programming Environment) is a tool to generate simulation programs for the NovaCarts realtime Hardware-in-the-Loop systems by MicroNova

name: NovaCarts
description: NovaCarts is the comprehensive software package that includes the real-time software for running real-time simulations on the simulation nodes and the Test Operation, the user software to configure and control the real-time hardware-in-the-loop systems created by MicroNova

name: mcp-fmi
description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the FMI. Allows AI-agents to use FMU simulation models as tools.

name: MoBA Automation
description: MoBA Automation automates individual workflows in the areas of simulation, measurement and software development. For parameter studies, model reduction or other worfklows for model based development, batch simulation tasks for FMUs and SSPs are available

name: modeFRONTIER
description: modeFRONTIER is a comprehensive solution for process automation and optimization in the engineering design process

name: Impact
description: Modelon Impact is a radically different system design engineering simulation software. Bring the power of decision making to everyone in your organization

name: MuSES
description: EO/IR Signature simulation software that can be coupled with CFD, FEA, and 1D tools

name: MWORKS
description: Modelica environment from Suzhou Tongyuan

name: NANDRAD
description: Building and district energy simulation solver

name: OMSimulator
description: The OMSimulator project is a FMI-based co-simulation environment that supports ordinary (i.e., non-delayed) and TLM connections

name: Open Simulation Platform
description: Tools, libraries and interfaces for co-simulation of multiphysical and cyberphysical systems

name: OpenModelica
description: Open source Modelica environment from OSMC

name: OPTIMICA Compiler Toolkit
description: Modelica-based mathematical engine that offers solution for the automation, simulation and optimization of system behaviors throughout the model-based design cycle

name: optiSLang
description: optiSLang supports the export of Metamodels of optimal Prognosis (MOP) as FMU

name: OTFMI
description: FMI models manipulation module for OpenTURNS

name: Overture
description: Modelling tool for the Vienna Development Method with supports for export of tool wrapper and source code FMUs

name: pandapower-FMU
description: open source tool for power system modeling

name: Persalys
description: GUI dedicated to the treatment of uncertainty and the management of variabilities

name: PLECS
description: Simulation platform for power electronic systems

name: PragmaDev Studio
description: Modeling and testing tools for communicating systems

name: PROOSIS
description: PROOSIS, Propulsion Object-Oriented Simulation Software

name: PROVEtech:RE
description: A compact and cost-efficient modular test platform for ECU verification and validation. Supports Multi-I/O, automotive bus systems such as CAN, CAN FD, LIN, FlexRay, Automotive Ethernet, AUTOSAR Classic and Adaptive modules, as well as FMI 2.0 and FMI 3.0 FMUs for HiL and SiL testing.

name: PROVEtech:TA
description: The comprehensive test automation tool for HiL, SiL and MiL. PROVEtech:TA offers modules for vehicle diagnostics (ASAM MCD-3 D), electrical fault simulation, CCP, XCP, J1939, ISO-TP, AUTOSAR, video/audio processing, real-time tests and many more. It visualizes, controls and measures signals and bus messages (CAN (FD), LIN, Automotive Ethernet, FlexRay, MOST). PROVEtech:TA supports manual testing as well as database driven test management for automated testing.

name: pSeven
description: pSeven is a software platform that provides advanced tools for Design Optimization and Predictive Modeling, packaged in an easy-to-use graphical user interface

name: PSIM
description: Simulation software for power electronics and motor drive control system

name: PyFMI
description: For Python via the open source package PyFMI from Modelon. Also available as part of the Optimica Compiler Toolkit and Modelon Impact

name: PythonFMU
description: A Python tool coupling solution that allows Python code to be exported as co-simulation FMUs

name: RecurDyn
description: High End Multi Flexible Body Dynamics Software from FunctionBay

name: SaberEXP
description: SaberEXP is a piecewise linear (PWL) circuit simulator that enables design teams to start early and validate their power supply/converter and motor drive designs prior to physical implementation with its fast simulation convergence. It provides a scalable simulation solution for accelerating power electronics designs with its seamless export flow into SaberRD for high fidelity large system design

name: SaberRD
description: SaberRD is an intuitive, integrated environment for designing and analyzing power electronic systems and multi-domain physical systems

name: Sakal FMU Generator
description: Sakal FMU Generator tool converts signal files exported from Siemens, Allen Bradly PLC into FMUs and integrates with WinMOD via a specialized library, eliminating the need for custom add-ons. It enables co-simulation between WinMOD and 3D Experience, Amesim, and similar simulation software, enhancing Virtual Commissioning capabilities.

name: SCANeR Studio
description: SCANeR studio is a comprehensive software suite dedicated to automotive and transport simulation addressing both testing and driving for ADAS, Autonomous vehicle, HMI and headlight use cases

name: scFLOW
description: scFLOW is a thermo-fuild analysis system with polyhedral mesh

name: Scilab/Xcos FMU wrapper
description: FMI support for Scilab / Xcos a free and open source software for numerical computation

name: scSTREAM
description: scSTREAM is a thermo-fuild analysis system with structured mesh

name: Silver
description: Generation of virtual ECUs and virtual integration platform for Software in the Loop from Synopsys

name: SIM-VICUS
description: Building energy performance and district simulation tool

name: HyperLynx AMS
description: Hyperlynx AMS is an analog/mixed-signal circuit simulation tool that is integrated with the printed circuit board (PCB) schematic capture tool Xpedition Designer. HL-AMS can create and generate component models, perform time- and frequency-domain analyses, and provide detailed visualization and analysis of results. Compatible model types include SPICE, VHDL-AMS, Verilog-AMS, S Parameter, and IBIS.

name: Simcenter 3D Motion
description: Simcenter software combines system simulation, 3D CAE, and performance testing; Motion provides an accurate and robust 3D multi-body simulation model.

name: Simcenter 3D Multiphysics
description: Integrated platform for multiphysics simulations such as thermal-fluid or thermo-mechanical for turbomachinery and aerospace applications

name: Simcenter 3D Space Systems Thermal
description: Simcenter 3D thermal solver dedicated to thermal analyses for space-bound, orbiting and interplanetary vehicles

name: Simcenter Amesim
description: Integrated simulation platform for the analysis of multi-domain mechatronics systems by Siemens Digital Industries Software

name: Simcenter FLOEFD
description: Simcenter FLOEFD is a CAD-embedded computational fluid dynamics solution

name: Simcenter Flomaster
description: High capability 1D CFD tool for thermo-fluid simulation from Siemens Digital Industries Software

name: Simcenter HEEDS
description: A powerful design space exploration and optimization software interfacing with CAD and CAE tools to drive product innovation.

name: Simcenter Reduced Order Modeling
description: Simcenter Reduced Order Modeling is an easy-to-use platform for building, validating and exporting reduced order models (ROMs) from simulation and test data.

name: Simcenter STAR-CCM+
description: Simcenter STAR-CCM+ is the CFD-focused multiphysics engineering solution that uniquely integrates comprehensive physics with intelligent design exploration in a single CAD-to-solution environment.

name: Simcenter Studio
description: Simcenter Studio is an application in the Simcenter portfolio for generating and evaluating system architectures during the early concept phase

name: Simcenter System Architect
description: Simcenter System Architect offers effortless co-simulation of multiple heterogeneous models, enabling collaboration across domain boundaries and siloes.

name: Simcenter Webapp Server
description: Web based simulation server for Amesim & FMI models, with sharing capabilities, model parametrization, data visualization and consumable REST API.

name: Simcenter Testlab Classic & Neo
description: Test-based software platform integrating multidisciplinary engineering analysis and simulation models by Siemens Digital Industries Software

name: Simcenter Testlab RT
description: Plug-and-play and scalable real-time hardware and software platforms for real-time testing and x-in-the-loop testing by Siemens Digital Industries Software

name: SimGrid-FMI
description: SimGrid plugin to co-simulate distributed IT infrastructures and continuous multi-physical systems

name: SIMIT
description: Simulation platform for virtual commissioning (SiL, HiL) and operator training of manufacturing and process plants

name: SIMulation Workbench
description: SimWB is an open, powerful framework to run SIL, HIL, and MIL simulations under Concurrents hard real-time RedHawk OS that runs on COTS hardware

name: SimulationX
description: Multi-domain simulation tool based on Modelica Language for design, analysis, and virtual prototyping of complex systems. Imports Model Exchange and Co-Simulation FMUs of all versions, exports FMUs with source code and/or binaries for Windows and Linux.

name: Simpack
description: Simpack is a general multibody system simulation (MBS) software enabling analysts and engineers to simulate the non-linear motion of any mechanical or mechatronic system. It enables engineers to generate and solve virtual 3D models in order to predict and visualize dynamic motion, coupling forces and stresses.

name: Simulix
description: FMU builder for Simulink models (based on Simulink Coder)

name: Squish GUI Tester
description: Squish is a GUI Test Automation Tool. As an FMU importer, Squish test scripts can access all variables exposed by a FMU and is responsible for driving the simulation process

name: STIMULUS
description: STIMULUS enables system architects to write, and simulate functional requirements and to detect ambiguous, incorrect, missing, and conflicting requirements before the design even begins, thus creating the high-quality specifications needed for the validation of safety-critical systems. Eventually, you can import the log file containing the inputs and outputs that occurred during the Software in the Loop (SIL) and Hardware in the Loop (HIL) tests into Stimulus through an FMU, and any violation of the functional requirements will be detected.

name: Sulca
description: SULCA software is a tool for Ecodesign and for performing Life Cycle Assessments (LCA).

name: System Coupling
description: Ansys System Coupling is software for solving multi-physics co-simulations problems

name: System Modeler
description: Wolfram System Modeler is an easy-to-use modeling and simulation environment for cyber-physical systems. Adding the power of the Wolfram Language gives you a fully integrated environment for analyzing, understanding and quickly iterating system designs.

name: TAITherm
description: 3D Thermal Simulation Software that can be coupled with CFD, FEA, and 1D tools

name: TLK Energy Apps
description: Deploy FMUs as cloud-based simulation apps

name: Simulator Suite
description: Simulator Suite enables models to be simulated in various application programs like Excel, Python, LabVIEW, TRNSYS and C/C++ with special focus on evaluation of thermodynamic systems

name: TISC Suite
description: TISC Suite is a co-simulation environment that can be used to combine calculation models across simulators to form and simulate a complete system

name: Optimization Suite
description: Optimization Suite is an FMI-based optimization and fitting tool, especially for thermal systems. Optimization problems can be defined and solved, results can be evaluated and visualized

name: ModelFitter
description: ModelFitter enables automated parameter estimation and design of experiments (DOE) especially for dynamic, highly non-linear models using Excel as user interface

name: TPT
description: Test tool to test and verify embedded control software in all phases of software development

name: TRNSYS FMU Export Utility
description: A stand-alone tool for exporting FMUs for Co-Simulation from TRNSYS models

name: TWT Co-Simulation Framework
description: Communication layer tool to flexibly plug together models for performing a co-simulation; front-end for set-up, monitoring and post-processing included

name: U-TEST®
description: U-TEST® is a software platform that allows rapid prototyping / command and control applications / verification validation and integration benches enabling simulation of the tested system’s operational environment

name: VALDYN
description: Multi-body dynamic and kinematic simulation for valvetrain, powertrain and transmission systems from Ricardo Software

name: VenetDCP
description: VenetDCP is a distributed co-simulation platform  which enables to connect various models and tools over the internet and compose a cyberspace for integrated simulation test

name: VICUS Buildings
description: Innovative 3D building energy simulation software with physically detailed and accuracy controlled simulation engine.

name: VICUS Districts
description: 3D modeling and dynamic simulation tool for 5G networks and heat networks in cities and districts.

name: Virtual Dynamics
description: Multibody dynamics simulation software for internal combustion engines, transmissions and their components from FEV

name: VOLTA
description: VOLTA is a web platform for multidisciplinary business process optimization and simulation data management

name: WAVE-RT
description: Real-time, crank-angle resolved engine simulation tool for testing new engine management systems in SiL, HiL, and rapid-prototyping from Ricardo Software

name: WinMOD FM200
description: WinMOD CoSimulations extend the capabilities of WinMOD Systems by combining them with simulation tools from other manufacturers.

name: Wolfram Mathematica
description: Modern Technical Computing

name: Xentara
description: Xentara is an integrated software-based platform that brings together all dimensions of smart production

name: XFlow
description: XFlow is a next generation CFD software system that uses a proprietary state-of-the-art Lattice Boltzmann technology, and is specifically designed for companies who require accurate feedback on flow simulation, transient aerodynamics, water management and fluid-structure interaction.

name: xMOD
description: Heterogeneous model integration environment & virtual instrumentation and experimentation laboratory from IFPEN distributed by D2T

name: itemis CREATE
description: itemis CREATE (formerly YAKINDU Statechart Tools) supports the development of systems based on the concept of statecharts. It supports visual editing, interactive validation, and simulation of statecharts. Code generators translate the statecharts to state machine implementations for different target languages and platforms.

name: VDMCheck
description: VDMCheck verifies the XML configuration of FMUs using a formal VDM-SL model

name: UniFMU
description: UniFMU is a command line tool that facilitates the implementation of FMUs in other popular languages that would otherwise not be able to produce C-compatible binaries. It does this by providing a precompiled binary that is C-compatible, which then dispatches calls to the implementation of the model in the target language.

name: maestro
description: maestro is a co-simulation orchestration engine developed and maintained by the INTO-CPS Association.

name: INTO-CPS Application
description: The INTO-CPS Application is the front-end of the INTO-CPS tool chain. It allows running co-simulation using maestro.

name: Typhoon HIL Control Center
description: Real-time simulation software

name: Bodylight.js
description: Simulation library and toolset to compile FMU to WebAssembly and simulate FMI natively in web-browser.

name: MBSim
description: A multibody simulation tool for smooth and non-smooth dynamical systems, extensible via modules to control, hydraulic, flexible-body and other simulations

name: VeriStand
description: VeriStand is software for configuring and deploying hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) systems with a wide range of functionality, including simulation model integration, configurable data acquistion, test sequencing, and logging.

name: EPILYSIS
description: EPILYSIS is a FEA solver and optimizer for numerous structural analysis problems

name: META
description: META is a multi-purpose engineering simulation post-processor, with extended automation and customization capabilities, which meets the diverse needs of various CAE disciplines

name: KOMVOS
description: KOMVOS is a Simulation Data Management platform for the interactive browsing, visualization and handling of all data related to CAE analysis

name: CasADi
description: CasADi is an open-source framework for numerical optimization and algorithmic differentiation for C++, Python, MATLAB and Octave.

name: fmi_adapter for ROS
description: ROS package for wrapping FMUs into ROS nodes, supporting node-based and library-based usage

name: FMU4FOAM
description: A framework that enables the coupling of OpenFOAM with FMUs or the distribution of OpenFOAM as an FMU

name: Cosim Cloud
description: Cosim Cloud is cloud-native co-simulation platform based on the FMI standard

name: SmartUQ
description: SmartUQ is an engineering-focused machine learning, analytics, and uncertainty quantification solution for simulation, testing, and complex systems

name: SIL Kit FMU Importer
description: SIL Kit FMU Importer allows FMUs to join Vector SIL Kit simulations by synchronizing state, time, and data of an FMU with other SIL Kit participants. It allows cross-platform communication and communication between FMI 2.0 and FMI 3.0 FMUs (if their data types match).

name: qfmu
description: Generate standard system FMUs from command line

name: Abaqus
description: Abaqus is a software suite for finite element analysis and computer-aided engineering. It can connect to control applications exported as FMUs via the SIMULIA Co-simulation Engine.

name: JuliaSim
description: Modern modeling and simulation powered by machine learning

name: VI-CarRealTime
description: Vehicle dynamics and control engineers need a solution that optimizes vehicle and control system performance in a single system model to accelerate the vehicle development process. This solution is VI-CarRealTime - a real-time vehicle simulation environment using a single simplified vehicle model

name: Score
description: Score imports co-simulation FMUs into Microsoft Excel and carries out parameter studies in parallel simulations. The result can be filtered for variables which are interpolated for user defined time grids. Score worksheets can be furthermore exchanged ad hoc with other MS Excel users

name: CANape
description: Analysis, measurement and calibration of FMU models

name: Simulation Model Surrogater
description: Simulation Model Surrogater is AI Tool for Reducing the Computational Load of Simulation Models

name: ViPer CmpFmiRuntime
description: Software for simulating peripheral devices in virtual systems

name: BeamNG.tech
description: BeamNG.tech is a versatile and comprehensive simulator with a custom physics engine made in house. It supports vehicle simulation, including ADAS & AD challenges, scenario-based testing, automated data acquisition, driver's training applications and offers extensive model-, hardware-, and human-in-the-loop simulation capabilities.

name: OpenTwins
description: OpenTwins is a platform designed to facilitate the development of digital twins and is characterised by the exclusive use of open source components. The aim is to achieve a platform that covers all the functionalities that a digital twin may require, from the most basic ones, such as simply checking its real-time state, to more advanced ones, such as the inclusion of predicted or simulated data. Simulations are compatible with FMI standard.

name: iPhysics
description: iPhysics is a real-time 3D simulation software for virtual commissioning of mechatronic systems, including robots and complex machinery. It supports many CAD and PLC systems, allowing precise simulation and verification. This saves time and costs in the engineering process.

name: mosaik
description: An adaptor that allows coupling FMUs with the co-simulation framework mosaik

name: VLAB
description: ASTC provides the VLAB Simulator and virtual models of a broad variety of MCU families and custom ECUs. It adds robustness during the software development process.

name: esmini
description: a basic OpenSCENARIO player

name: OpenSBT
description: OpenSBT is a modular and open-source framework for the search-based testing of automated driving systems.

name: FMUGym
description: FMUGym is an interface for reinforcement learning-based control of FMUs under uncertainties

name: Femyou
description: Loading and running fmi-standard FMUs in .NET/dotnet

name: WRP-SimConductor
description: WRP-SimConductor, based on multi-time-domain and multi-disciplinary virtual integration and co-simulation methods, it achieves ‘virtual integration and simulation verification' of the system in the early design stages through ‘simulation architecture modeling'.

name: WRP-MirrorOne
description: WRP-MirrorOne, a virtual/real-time integrated simulation test machine product based on the time axis, designed to meet the comprehensive testing needs of large-scale digital systems across multiple disciplines, organizations, and specialized tools.

name: Reference FMUs
description: A set of hand-coded FMUs and a simulator for validation, development, testing, and debugging of the Functional Mock-up Interface.

name: fmi4c
description: An open-source C library that facilitates integrating FMI import in applications and tools

name: FMU Manipulation Toolbox
description: FMU Manipulation Toolbox is a Python package that allows you to analyze, modify or even create Functional Mockup Units (FMUs) without recompilation. It is highly customizable. It can modify the modelDescription.xml of existing FMUs. It also includes 'fmucontainer' which allows you to group multiple FMUs into one.

name: MLFMU
description: A tool to convert machine learning models to FMUs

name: Simulation Trust Center
description: Simulation Trust Center is a collaborative simulation tool that allows secure upload, storage, sharing, and execution of FMUs in a cloud-hosted co-simulation environment.

name: SIMSEN
vendor: EPFL and Power Vision Engineering Sarl
description: Software for simulating transient behaviour of complex hydraulic & electric systems, like adjustable speed drives. The software enables modelling, simulation and analysis of the power networks dynamic behavior, speed drives and hydraulic systems with arbitrary topology, including hydraulic circuits, electrical installations, rotating inertias and control/command systems.

name: Siemens NX MCD
description: Siemens NX MCD is an application that allows users to interactively design and simulate the complex motion of electromechanical systems and breaks down barriers between electrical, mechanical and automation engineers.

name: ctrlX OS - Model Connect
description: Model Connect is a runtime app for ctrlX OS devices, which allows a real-time execution of C++ code generated out of MATLAB/Simulink or the execution of Functional Mock-up Units coming from other FMI-supporting systems.

name: Virtual Components Modeling Library (vcml)
description: A modeling library with virtual components for SystemC and TLM simulators

name: MSArchitect
description: A modeling and simulation tool for creating, generating, and executing simulation models

name: baltamatica
description: A system simulation tool that uses process diagram visualization modeling

name: Virtual Studio Compiler
description: AVL Virtual Studio Compiler is a MATLAB add-on tool to create real-time applications as well as FMUs based on MATLAB Simulink Coder code generation. It allows to cross-compile FMUs for Linux and the TenAsys INtime RTOS used by AVL testbed systems.

name: Virtual Studio OPEN
description: AVL Virtual Studio OPEN is an open simulation platform for the integration of real-time applications into testbed systems. AVL PUMA 2™ based testbeds offer AVL Virtual Studio OPEN as integrated real-time platform in the testbed automation system. For usage with previous AVL PUMA generations or 3rd party automation systems, the solution is available as external simulation execution platform on a dedicated standalone hardware with standardized I/O interfaces, e.g. CAN-FD, UDP, EtherCAT.

name: vVIRTUALtarget
description: vVIRTUALtarget is a software for virtualizing individual software components and fully configured ECUs for all typical AUTOSAR projects.

name: iSuite 25
description: Streamlines model integration and introduces hierarchical parameter management, enabling a more efficient and scalable development process.

name: fmu-forge
description: fmu-forge is a C++ library that offers high-level utilities for exporting and importing FMUs.

name: chrono
description: The open-source multi-physics Chrono software provides extensions to fmu-forge for creating FMUs from Chrono models and simulations, as well as including model components provided as a model exchange FMU.

name: orchideo | easySSP
description: orchideo | easySSP is a platform for credible simulations, enabling traceable architecture design, execution, and efficient workflows based on open standards like SSP and FMI

name: Pictorus
description: Browser-based modeling, simulation, and code generation

name: SODA.Sim
description: Automotive simulation tool supporting full vehicle system modeling and real-time hardware integration

name: ODE Transfer
description: Cross-compiles your source code FMUs to WebAssembly, enabling instant execution of simulation models directly in any web browser. Share live, interactive models with a simple link—no software installation or setup required for recipients.

name: ODE+ Component
description: Cloud-native and AI-first platform powered by Modelica for high-fidelity multi-domain physical modeling and simulation

name: ODE+ Interaction
description: Customizable panel editor with drag-and-drop widgets for intuitive parameter control and real-time data visualization

name: ODE+ Vision
description: High-fidelity 3D rendering with physics-based lighting and animation for comprehensive simulation behavior analysis

name: ODE+ System
description: Create and edit System Structure and Parameterization (SSP) with Functional Mock-up Units (FMUs) for scalable, hierarchical system simulation

name: PathSim
description: A Python native dynamical system simulation framework in the block diagram paradigm.

name: Fedem
description: Finite element dynamics in elastic mechanisms, a flexible multi-body non-linear dynamics simulation tool with integrated control system

name: shonTA
description: A systematic simulation tool based on a 1D network method and 3D FEM

name: osi-ros2-bridge
description: This FMU receives ASAM OSI SensorData and outputs various information as ROS2 messages. It enables ROS2 nodes to receive data from ASAM OSI FMUs, e.g. synthetic perception sensor data from a lidar or radar sensor model FMU.

name: Sensor Model Development Library (SMDL)
description: The SMDL is a C++/Cuda library that can be integrated into sensor model FMUs for co-simulation. It takes care of the simulation of the signal propagation of lidar and radar sensors in a virtual environment. The SMDL is fully built on ASAM OSI and ASAM OpenMATERIAL 3D input data.

name: EC-Simulator
description: EtherCAT® network simulation with FMU to EtherCAT® process data mapping
